tit.j: 開拓使官有物払下げ事件
tit.e: The scandal over the sale of the property owned by the Hokkaido Development Agency
The scandal over the sale of the property owned by the Hokkaido Development Agency
The scandal over the sale of the property owned by the Hokkaido Development Agency

sen.j: 開拓使官有物払下げ事件（かいたくしかんゆうぶつはらいさげじけん）は、北海道開拓使長官の黒田清隆が開拓使の官有物払下げを決定したところ、世論の厳しい批判を浴び、払下げ中止となった事件を指す。
sen.e: The scandal over the sale of the property owned by the Hokkaido Development Agency was the incident that the decision to sell the property owned by the Agency made by Kiyotaka KURODA, the director of the Hokkaido Development Commission, was cancelled due to the heavy criticism from the public.

The scandal over the sale of the property owned by the Hokkaido Development Agency was the incident that the decision to sell the property owned by the Agency made by Kiyotaka KURODA, the director of the Hokkaido Development Commission, was cancelled due to the heavy criticism from the public.

The scandal over the sale of the property owned by the Hokkaido Development Agency was the incident that the decision to sell the property owned by the Agency made by Kiyotaka KURODA, the director of the Hokkaido Development Commission, was cancelled due to the heavy criticism from the public.

sen.j: 明治十四年の政変のきっかけとなり、伊藤博文が大隈重信を政府から追放。
sen.e: The incident triggered the Meiji juyonen no seihen (the political changes of 1881), in which Hirofumi ITO removed Shigenobu OKUMA from his government post.
The incident triggered the Meiji juyonen no seihen (the political changes of 1881), in which Hirofumi ITO removed Shigenobu OKUMA from his government post.
The incident triggered the Meiji juyonen no seihen (the political changes of 1881), in which Hirofumi ITO removed Shigenobu OKUMA from his government post.

sen.j: また、国会開設の詔勅が出された。
sen.e: Also, the Imperial Edict for Establishing a Diet was issued.
Also, the Imperial Edict for Establishing a Diet was issued.
Also, the Imperial Edict for Establishing a Diet was issued.

tit.e: The course of events happened until the decision to sell the property was made.
The course of events which happened until the decision to sell the property was made.
tit.cmt: 関係代名詞が必要です。
tit.e: The course of events which happened until the decision to sell the property was made.

sen.j: 開拓使は、北方開拓のために1869年（明治2年）7月から1882年（明治15年）2月まで置かれた官庁である。
sen.e: The Hokkaido Development Agency was the government office placed from July 1869 to February 1882 in order to develop the northern district of Japan.
The Hokkaido Development Agency was the government office placed from July 1869 to February 1882 in order to develop the northern district of Japan.
The Hokkaido Development Agency was the government office placed from July 1869 to February 1882 in order to develop the northern district of Japan.

sen.j: 黒田はロシアに対抗する国力を充実させるため北海道の開拓に力を入れるべきだという建議を行った。
sen.e: Kuroda submitted a memorial to the government that Japan should put effort into the development of Hokkaido to enhance the national strength to oppose Russia.
KURODA submitted a proposal to the government that Japan should put more effort into the development of Hokkaido to enhance the national strength to oppose Russia.
sen.cmt: 人名の姓は大文字で表記します。「建議」は用語集に従ってproposalとします。
sen.e: KURODA submitted a proposal to the government that Japan should put more effort into the development of Hokkaido to enhance the national strength to oppose Russia.

sen.j: これに従い、1871年（明治4年）8月19日に10年間1000万両をもって総額とするという大規模予算計画、いわゆる開拓使十年計画が決定された。
sen.e: Following the proposal, it was decided to carry out the so-called Kaitakushi Junen Keikaku (Ten-year project to develop Hokkaido), the big-budget project for which the total budget of one thousand ryo was prepared for ten years.

Following the proposal, it was decided to carry out the so-called Kaitakushi Junen Keikaku (Ten-year project to develop Hokkaido), the big-budget project for which the total budget of one thousand ryo was prepared for ten years.

Following the proposal, it was decided to carry out the so-called Kaitakushi Junen Keikaku (Ten-year project to develop Hokkaido), the big-budget project for which the total budget of one thousand ryo was prepared for ten years.

sen.j: 黒田は米国人ホーレス・ケプロンらのお雇い外国人を招いて、政策の助言と技術の伝習を行った。
sen.e: Having invited the hired foreigners, such as American Horace Capron and others, Kuroda gave political advice and taught new techniques.
Having invited the hired foreigners, such as American Horace CAPRON and others, KURODA gave political advice and taught new techniques.
sen.cmt: 姓は大文字で表記します。
sen.e: Having invited the hired foreigners, such as American Horace CAPRON and others, KURODA gave political advice and taught new techniques.

sen.j: 開拓使は潤沢な予算を用いて様々な開拓事業を推進した。
sen.e: The ample budget allowed the Hokkaido Development Commissioners to promote various development works.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The ample budget allowed the Hokkaido Development Commissioners to promote various development works.
The ample budget allowed the Hokkaido Development Commissioners to promote various development works.

sen.j: しかし、なおも全てを完遂するには不足であった。
sen.e: However, still, the budget was not enough to complete all projects.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the budget was still not enough to complete all projects.
sen.cmt: 副詞stillはbe動詞の後に置きます。
sen.e: However, the budget was still not enough to complete all projects.

sen.j: 測量・道路などの基礎的事業を早々に切り上げ、産業育成に重点をおいた。
sen.e: They cut the basic development works, such as land surveying and roadworks, short as soon as possible and put priority on the development of the industries.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They quickly cut short the basic development works such as land surveying and roadworks and put priority on the development of the industries.
sen.cmt: cutとshortの間が離れすぎています。「早々に」を「できるだけ早く」と訳したのでは意訳に過ぎます。
sen.e: They quickly cut short the basic development works such as land surveying and roadworks and put priority on the development of the industries.

sen.j: 十年計画の満期が近くなった1881年（明治14年）に開拓使の廃止方針が固まった。
sen.e: In 1881 when the expiration date of the ten-year project was close, the policy to abolish the Hokkaido Development Agency was settled.
In 1881 when the expiration date of the ten-year project was close, the policy to abolish the Hokkaido Development Agency was settled.
In 1881 when the expiration date of the ten-year project was close, the policy to abolish the Hokkaido Development Agency was settled.

sen.j: 黒田は開拓使の事業を継承させるために、部下の官吏を退職させて企業を起こし、官有の施設・設備を安値で払い下げることにした。
sen.e: In order to take over the development businesses undertaken by the Hokkaido Development Agency, Kuroda decided to make the government officials who worked under him retire to establish a company and sell the facilities and equipments belonging to the government at a low price.

In order to take over the development businesses undertaken by the Hokkaido Development Agency, KURODA decided to make the government officials who worked under him retire to establish a company and sell the facilities and equipments belonging to the government at a low price.
sen.cmt: 姓は大文字で表記します。
sen.e: In order to take over the development businesses undertaken by the Hokkaido Development Agency, KURODA decided to make the government officials who worked under him retire to establish a company and sell the facilities and equipments belonging to the government at a low price.

sen.j: 黒田は、事業には私利で動かない官吏出身者をあてるべきだと主張した。
sen.e: Kuroda claimed that the old government officials who don't move because they cannot gain personal advantage should be assigned to the development business.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: KURODA claimed that those who once had been government officials should be assigned to the development business because they would not work for themselves.
sen.cmt: 姓は大文字で表記します。また「私利で動かない」の訳出が不適切です。
sen.e: KURODA claimed that those who once had been government officials should be assigned to the development business because they would not work for themselves.

sen.j: また事業が赤字であったことを理由に、非常な安値を付けた。
sen.e: Because the business was in the red, Kuroda put very cheap price.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, he extremely underpriced the facilities and equipments he tried to sell, on the pretext of loss-making operations of the business.
sen.cmt: 単に「赤字だったから」ではなく、「赤字であることを口実に」というニュアンスを出します。
sen.e: Furthermore, he extremely underpriced the facilities and equipments he tried to sell, on the pretext of loss-making operations of the business.

sen.j: 払下げの対象は船舶、倉庫、農園、炭鉱、ビール・砂糖工場などであった。
sen.e: Among the properties to be sold, the ships, the storehouses, the plantations, the coal mining, the beer and sugar factories, etc. were included.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Among the properties to be sold, the ships, the storehouses, the plantations, the coal mining, the beer and sugar factories, etc. were included.
Among the properties to be sold, the ships, the storehouses, the plantations, the coal mining, the beer and sugar factories, etc. were included.

sen.j: およそ1400万円の費用を投じたものを38万円（無利息30年賦）で払下げるというものであった。
sen.e: The plan was that the properties for which approximately 14,000,000 yen were invested were sold at the price of 380,000 yen (yearly installment for thirty years at 0 % interest).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The plan was to sell the properties, into which approximately 14,000,000 yen had been invested, at a price of 380,000 yen (yearly installment for thirty years at 0 % interest).
sen.cmt: The plan is to不定詞～の形の方が自然です。また「…に（費用）を投じる」の前置詞はintoが適切です。
sen.e: The plan was to sell the properties, into which approximately 14,000,000 yen had been invested, at a price of 380,000 yen (yearly installment for thirty years at 0 % interest).

sen.j: 開拓使大書記官であった安田定則らの作った北海社が工場経営などの事業に当たる。
sen.e: Hokkaisya, the company that Sadanori YASUDA who was the great secretary of the Hokkaido Development Agency and other members were established, conducted the development business such as the factory management.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Hokkaisya, a company established by Sadanori YASUDA, who was the great secretary of the Hokkaido Development Agency, and other members, conducted the development business such as the factory management.
sen.cmt: YASUDAを主語としてwere establishedとするのは誤りです。
sen.e: Hokkaisya, a company established by Sadanori YASUDA, who was the great secretary of the Hokkaido Development Agency, and other members, conducted the development business such as the factory management.

sen.j: しかし資本がないため関西貿易商会（黒田と同郷で薩摩出身の五代友厚らの経営）が払下げを引受けることになった。
sen.e: However, due to the lack of financial resources, Kansai-boeki-shokai (the company run by Kuroda and Tomoatsu GODAI who came from Satsuma, the same hometown with Kuroda) accepted to buy the properties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, due to a lack of financial resources, Kansai-boeki-shokai (a company run by Tomoatsu GODAI, who was from Satsuma just as KURODA) agreed to buy the properties.
sen.cmt: かっこ内の日本文が正しく英語に反映されていません。
sen.e: However, due to a lack of financial resources, Kansai-boeki-shokai (a company run by Tomoatsu GODAI, who was from Satsuma just as KURODA) agreed to buy the properties.

tit.e: The criticism of selling the properties
The criticism of selling the properties
The criticism of selling the properties

sen.j: 政府内でも批判の声が起こり、特に払下げの規則を作った前大蔵卿の大隈が反対した。
sen.e: In the government, some criticized the sale of the properties, especially Okuma, the previous Minister of the Treasury, who made the rules to sell the properties opposed it.

Some people criticized the sale of the properties even within the government, and especially OKUMA, the previous Minister of the Treasury who made a rule for sales of the properties, strongly opposed it.
sen.cmt: この「政府内でも」は「政府内でさえも」と強い意味に訳しました。姓は大文字で表記します。
sen.e: Some people criticized the sale of the properties even within the government, and especially OKUMA, the previous Minister of the Treasury who made a rule for sales of the properties, strongly opposed it.

sen.j: 7月に払下げ計画が新聞にすっぱ抜かれると、大隈が秘密を漏らしたのだろうと疑われた。
sen.e: When the plan to sell the properties was exposed by a newspaper article in July, Okuma was suspected of having leaked the secret information.
When the plan of the sales was exposed by a newspaper article in July, OKUMA was suspected of having leaked the secret information.
sen.cmt: 姓は大文字で表記します。
sen.e: When the plan of the sales was exposed by a newspaper article in July, OKUMA was suspected of having leaked the secret information.

sen.j: これ以前に三菱の岩崎弥太郎が開拓使の船舶の払下げを願い出て却下された経緯があった。
sen.e: Before the event, Yataro IWASAKI, the founder of the Mitsubishi Co., applied for permission to sell the ship owned by the Hokkaido Development Agency but his request was rejected.
Before the event, Yataro IWASAKI, the founder of the Mitsubishi Co., applied for permission to sell the ship owned by the Hokkaido Development Agency but his request was rejected.
Before the event, Yataro IWASAKI, the founder of the Mitsubishi Co., applied for permission to sell the ship owned by the Hokkaido Development Agency but his request was rejected.

sen.j: このため世間では、三菱と大隈が結びついて、薩摩に対抗していると見られた。
sen.e: Because of this, people thought that Mitsubishi joined hands with Okuma to oppose Satsuma.
Because of this, people thought that Mitsubishi joined hands with OKUMA in the opposition against Satsuma.
sen.cmt: 姓は大文字で表記します。
sen.e: Because of this, people thought that Mitsubishi joined hands with OKUMA in the opposition against Satsuma.

sen.j: 更に大隈が登用した大蔵官僚の間にも払い下げ中止を求める意見が出された事から、払い下げ中止を目的として大隈が仕掛けたいう説が広まった。
sen.e: In addition to that, because some bureaucrats of the Ministry of Finance who were hired by Okura submitted the request to stop the sale of the properties, it was rumored that Okuma leaked the information to stop the sale.

In addition to that, because some bureaucrats of the Ministry of Finance who had been recruited by OKUMA submitted a request to stop the sale of the properties, it was rumored that OKUMA leaked the information to stop the sale.
sen.cmt: 姓は大文字で表記します。「登用する」はrecruitの方が適切です。
sen.e: In addition to that, because some bureaucrats of the Ministry of Finance who had been recruited by OKUMA submitted a request to stop the sale of the properties, it was rumored that OKUMA leaked the information to stop the sale.

sen.j: 黒田は強引に天皇の裁許を得て払下げを決定した。
sen.e: Having obtained the Emperor's approval forcibly, Kuroda decided the sale of the properties.
Having obtained the Emperor's approval forcibly, KURODA decided to sell the properties.
sen.cmt: 姓は大文字で表記します。
sen.e: Having obtained the Emperor's approval forcibly, KURODA decided to sell the properties.

sen.j: 批判の声は益々高まった。
sen.e: The criticism was increasing in volume.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The criticism was increasing.
sen.cmt: 「批判」についてin volumeとするのは不自然です。
sen.e: The criticism was increasing.

sen.j: 御用新聞の東京日日新聞までが政府批判を行ったほか、各地で弾劾の演説会が催された。
sen.e: Even the Tokyo Nichinichi Newspaper that followed the government line criticized the government and the speeches to criticize the government were given in various places.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even the Tokyo Nichinichi Newspaper, famous for blindly praising the policies of the government, criticized the government and the speeches to criticize the government were given in various places.
sen.cmt: 「御用新聞」を詳しく説明します。
sen.e: Even the Tokyo Nichinichi Newspaper, famous for blindly praising the policies of the government, criticized the government and the speeches to criticize the government were given in various places.

sen.j: 天皇は地方行幸に赴き、大隈はこれに同行していた。
sen.e: When the Emperor visited the provinces, Okuma went together.
When the Emperor visited the provinces, OKUMA went together.
sen.cmt: 姓は大文字で表記します。
sen.e: When the Emperor visited the provinces, OKUMA went together.

sen.j: その間に伊藤らは収拾策の方針を決定。
sen.e: During Okuma's absence, Ito and other members were decided the plan to solve the problem.
During OKUMA's absence, ITO and other members decided on a plan to solve the problem.
sen.cmt: 姓は大文字で表記します。「…を決定する」はdecide on…です。
sen.e: During OKUMA's absence, ITO and other members decided on a plan to solve the problem.

sen.j: 天皇が10月11日に帰京すると裁許を仰いだ。
sen.e: When the Emperor returned to Tokyo on October 11, they asked the permission of the plan.
When the Emperor returned to Tokyo on October 11, they asked for the permission for the plan.
sen.cmt: 「…を求める」という時はask for…と前置詞forが必要です。
sen.e: When the Emperor returned to Tokyo on October 11, they asked for the permission for the plan.

sen.j: 翌12日、大隈の追放、国会開設の詔勅、払下げ中止などを発表した。
sen.e: The next day of October 12th, they announced the banishment of Okuma, the Imperial Edict for Establishing a Diet, and the cancelation of the sale, etc.
On the next day, October 12th, they announced the banishment of OKUMA, the Imperial Edict for Establishing a Diet, and the cancelation of the sale, etc.
sen.cmt: 姓は大文字で表記します。
sen.e: On the next day, October 12th, they announced the banishment of OKUMA, the Imperial Edict for Establishing a Diet, and the cancelation of the sale, etc.

sen.j: 一種のクーデターである（明治十四年の政変）。
sen.e: It was a coup d'etat of sorts (the Meiji juyonen no seihen [the political changes of 1881]).
It was a kind of coup d'etat (the Meiji juyonen no seihen [the political changes of 1881]).
It was a kind of coup d'etat (the Meiji juyonen no seihen [the political changes of 1881]).

sen.j: その後、黒田も開拓長官を辞めて内閣顧問の閑職に退いた。
sen.e: Later, Kuroda also retired the director of the Hokkaido Development Agency and moved to a less important position of a Cabinet advisor.
Later, KURODA also retired from director of the Hokkaido Development Agency and moved to a less important position of a Cabinet advisor.
sen.cmt: 姓は大文字で表記します。「…を引退する」という場合前置詞fromが必要です。
sen.e: Later, KURODA also retired from director of the Hokkaido Development Agency and moved to a less important position of a Cabinet advisor.

sen.j: 開拓使は翌1882年（明治15年）に廃止された。
sen.e: The following year, 1882, the Hokkaido Development Agency was abolished.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the following year, 1882, the Hokkaido Development Agency was abolished.
In the following year, 1882, the Hokkaido Development Agency was abolished.

sen.j: 北海道は函館県、札幌県、根室県に分けられた。
sen.e: Hokkaido was separated into Hakodate Prefecture, Sapporo Prefecture, and Nemuro Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Hokkaido was separated into Hakodate Prefecture, Sapporo Prefecture, and Nemuro Prefecture.
Hokkaido was separated into Hakodate Prefecture, Sapporo Prefecture, and Nemuro Prefecture.
